title: A Tale of Two Economies Is Reshaping China’s Stock Market
summary: A tale of two economies is driving China’s stock market, prompting investors to raise bets on the beneficiaries of an industrial export boom at the expense of firms mired in a consumption slump.

title: AI chatbots as your investment advisor: The risks investors aren't seeing
summary: While AI chatbots are a great tool to learn concepts, narrow down choices or even discover options, the risk lies in treating recommendations as advice. Action-oriented money decision-making driven by AI can be risky

title: Union Budget 2026 to US Fed meet, Q3 results - Top five triggers that may dictate Indian stock market this week
summary: On Friday, both benchmark indices took a U-turn, slipping back into the red amid profit booking, after posting notable gains of around half a percent in the previous session.

title: Lawsuit Claims Meta Can See WhatsApp Chats in Breach of Privacy
summary: An international group of plaintiffs sued Meta Platforms, Inc. alleging that the company has made false claims about the privacy and security of its WhatsApp chat service.

title: US Fed set to keep rates steady as officials defend independence
summary: The US Federal Reserve is widely expected to keep interest rates unchanged when it meets in the coming week, holding firm despite President Donald Trump's pressure to slash levels as it guards against threats to its independence. - External pressure - The Fed meets eight times a year to consider interest rate levels, and Michael Pearce of Oxford Economics said the dilemma it faces has eased.

title: Are your WhatsApp messages really private? Fresh lawsuit challenges Meta's privacy claims
summary: Meta is being sued for allegedly misleading users about WhatsApp's encryption. An internation group of plaintiffs are arguing that the company can access private communications on its personal messaging platform.&nbsp;

title: ACME Group plans $1.4 bn green methanol plant in Odisha, inks agreement
summary: ACME Group has partnered with the Odisha government to invest $1.4 billion in a green methanol facility to meet the growing demand for sustainable maritime fuels.
